Package cp213

Class Polynomial

java.lang.Object
cp213.Polynomial
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Term>
public class Polynomial extends Object implements Iterable<Term>
This class defines polynomial objects. It contains a collection of Term objects, each of which represents a polynomial monomial. The index in the collection represents the exponent of the Term. Polynomials can be added, subtracted, multiplied, differentiated, and copied. TODO: division. Polynomials can be evaluated for x using Horner's Rule.
Version:
2022-03-18
Author:
your name, David Brown

      Coefficients constructor.
      Parameters:
      coefficients - List of coefficients.
      Throws:
      Exception - on bad Term construction

    • Polynomial

      public Polynomial(Polynomial that) throws Exception
      Copy constructor. The contents of that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The Polynomial to copy.
      Throws:
      Exception - Exception on bad Term construction (should never be thrown from this constructor assuming that is valid.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public Polynomial add(Polynomial that) throws Exception
      Adds that to this to produce a new Polynomial. The contents of this and that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The Polynomial to add to this.
      Returns:
      A new Polynomial that is the addition of that to this.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an invalid Term is constructed.

    • addTerm

      public void addTerm(Term term) throws Exception
      Adds a copy of term to the end of the polynomial. The Term's exponent n and its index in this must match.
      Parameters:
      term - The term to add to the end of this.
      Throws:
      Exception - If term's exponent n and its index in this do not match, throws exception with message: "exponent and index do not match"

    • degree

      public int degree()
      Returns:
      The degree of this, i.e. the highest exponent amongst the Polynomial's Terms, which should be the last exponent.

    • differentiate

      public Polynomial differentiate() throws Exception
      Returns:
      A new Polynomial target is the differential of this. target contains only the Term(0,0) if the last Term of this has exponent 0, i.e. is a constant value. The contents of this are unchanged.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an invalid Term is constructed.

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(double x)
      Evaluates this using Horner's Rule.
      Parameters:
      x - A value for x.
      Returns:
      The sum of the Terms of this for the given value of x.

    • getTerm

      public Term getTerm(int i)
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the Term to return.
      Returns:
      The Term at index i in this.

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Term> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<Term>

    • multiply

      public Polynomial multiply(Polynomial that) throws Exception
      Multiplies that by this to produce a new Polynomial. The contents of this and that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The Polynomial to multiply by this.
      Returns:
      A new Polynomial that is the multiplication of that by this.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an invalid Term is constructed.

    • setTerm

      public void setTerm(int i, Term term) throws Exception
      Replaces a Term in this with a copy of another Term.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the Term to replace.
      term - The new Term.
      Throws:
      Exception - If term's exponent n and its index in this do not match, throws exception with message: "exponent and index do not match"

    • subtract

      public Polynomial subtract(Polynomial that) throws Exception
      Subtracts that from this to produce a new Polynomial. The contents of this and that are unchanged.
      Parameters:
      that - The Polynomial to subtract from this.
      Returns:
      A new Polynomial that is the subtraction of that from this.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the exponent and index do not match, or an invalid Term is constructed.
